title: Indonesia Says US Export Tariff Cut to 15% After Court Ruling
body: Indonesia confirms US tariffs on its exports are now 15%, not 19%, after a Supreme Court ruling reshaped trade policy.

title: Indonesia to Defend Solar Panel Exports as US Imposes Up to 143% Duties
body: Indonesia will defend its solar panel exports after the US imposed provisional duties of up to 143% in an anti-subsidy probe.

title: Rupiah Weakens to Rp 16,793 as Geopolitics, Fed Rate Outlook Weigh on Markets
body: Rupiah fell 34 points to Rp 16,793 per dollar on Friday as US-Iran tensions, tariff uncertainty, and shifting Fed rate cut expectations

title: Malaysia Envoy: Indonesia Partnership Key to ASEAN’s Future Resilience
body: Malaysia’s envoy says deeper Indonesia–Malaysia ties and stronger ASEAN cooperation are key to navigating global uncertainty.

title: JCI Closes Nearly Unchanged at 8,235 as Investors Turn Cautious
body: JCI ended flat at 8,235 as investors stayed cautious amid rising trade tensions, China policy uncertainty, and fiscal pressure warnings.

title: Controversial US Trade Deal Actually Protects Indonesian Labor Rights
body: The US has demanded Jakarta to amend its labor law to "prohibit the outsourcing of core business sanctions".

title: Astra Posts Rp 32.8T Profit in 2025 Despite Coal, Auto Headwinds
body: Astra posted Rp 32.8T net profit in 2025, down 3% YoY, as lower coal prices and weaker car sales weighed on earnings despite gains elsewhere

title: End of An Era: Modern Retail Leaves Indonesia with Just 3.9 Million Warung

title: Beyond Tariffs: Indonesia’s Uneven Pact with Washington
body: A study indicates that the risks from the reciprocal trade agreement could outweigh the benefits.

title: Indonesia Aims for $17.5 Billion Transactions in Trade Expo
body: Last year, the Trade Expo Indonesia registered $22.8 billion in transactions.

title: Rupiah Climbs 41 Points as Markets Track US-Iran Talks
body: Rupiah strengthens 41 points to Rp 16,759 as markets monitor US-Iran talks, tariff uncertainty and fading Fed rate cut hopes.
